text:
As Per ‘Brienne Of Tarth’ We’ll Need Therapy After GoT S8 & Our Anxiety Level Is On Its Peak!
As Per ‘Brienne Of Tarth’ We’ll Need Therapy After GoT S8 & Our Anxiety Level Is On Its Peak!
Who will sit on the Iron Throne? Who will defeat the Night King? Who will die and who will survive? – There are endless questions that we have right now about Game of Thrones season 8 which will not be answered until April 2019. Because that’s when the finale season of the American-fantasy drama will air.
How will it all end? There are going to be big twists, bigger than The Red Wedding, said David Nutter. Not everyone is going to be happy at the end of the show, said Kit Harington who plays the role of Jon Snow.
With all these little details we are getting anxious already, and adding to our misery, Gwendoline Christie, who plays Brienne of Tarth in Game of Thrones, has recently said that people will need therapy after having watched the finale of Game of Thrones.
Twitter
“You’re going to need therapy,” Christie said, without confirming or denying a question about whether or not people are dying.
cimg.tvgcdn.net
Don't Miss 161 SHARES 842 SHARES
“I think just the show ending is going to send all of the world into professional help,” she added.
Twitter
“I think it’s going to make me incredibly emotional. We’re all emotional about the fact that this is the end, and this is the end of something incredibly significant for all of us, and it’s been a truly incredible thing to be a part of,” she said.
Thanks, Gwendoline Christie. Now, we are even more impatient. April, please come soon. We just cannot wait for Game of Thrones season 8.
Also Read: 9 Insanely Convincing ‘Game Of Thrones’ Season 8 Theories That Will Pump You Up For The Finale
With inputs from PTI
title: As Per ‘Brienne Of Tarth’ We’ll Need Therapy After GoT S8 & Our Anxiety Level Is On Its Peak!
